citation.article-title: Filobacillus milensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new halophilic spore-forming bacterium with Orn-D-Glu-type peptidoglycan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Filobacillus milensis sp. nov.
Filobacillus milensis (mi.len'sis. M.L. gen. n. milensis from the island Milos, Greece, where the organism was isolated)
Cells are motile, one flagellum is laterally inserted.
On M13(3¬)­10% NaCl colonies are white, smooth and 1-2 mm diameter.
Does not grow (or grows very poorly) in media without NaCl.
The NaCl range is approximately 2-23% with an optimum of 8-14%.
Temperature optimum is from 33 to 38 °C., maximum growth temperature is between 40 and 42 °C.
The pH range of growth is 6.5-8.9 with an optimum between 7.3 and 7.8.
Hippurate, DNA and tributyrin are hydrolysed.
Aesculin, casein, gelatin, starch and pullulan are not hydrolysed.
Acid is not produced from D-glucose, D-galactose, D-fructose, maltose, mannitol, sucrose, trehalose or D-xylose.
Sensitive to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline, but not to kanamycin.
Other characters as for the genus description.
The G­C content of the DNA is 35 mol%.
Type strain is SH 714T (=DSM13259T=ATCC 700960T), isolated from a beach sediment from Palaeochori Bay, Milos, Greece.
